question_text:
Question 61
 
 
Heat is available at a rate of 2 kW from a thermal reservoir at 400 K.  A two-stage process harnesses this 
heat to produce power.  Stages 1 and 2 reject heat at 360 K and 300 K, respectively.  Stage 2 is driven by 
the heat rejected by Stage 1.  If the overall process efficiency is 50% of the corresponding Carnot 
efficiency, the power delivered by the process, in kW, rounded off to 2 decimal places, is ________.
[Thermodynamics 2 marks]
 
Ans. 0.24 to 0.26
